snippet: A new law that allows businesses in Philadelphia’s Market East district to draw revenue from large digital signs has drawn attention from developers.
abstract: Sign ordinance passed in Philadelphia to help create a digital district in the Market East section allows developers, in exchange for a minimum investment of $10 million, to erect and collect revenue from large digital signs and billboards on the outside of area buildings; Philadelphia Media Network, which publishes The Philadelphia Inquirer and The Daily News, is the first business to take advantage of the new law, signing a lease for 125,000 square feet of space on Market Street.
lead_paragraph: A new law that allows businesses in Philadelphia’s Market East district to draw revenue from large digital signs has drawn attention from developers.

headline.seo: In Philadelphia’s Market East, Sign Law Spurs Investment
headline.main: A Sign Law Spurs Investment in Philadelphia
headline.print_headline: A Sign Law Spurs Investment in Philadelphia
